abstract: Amazon.com deleted purchased e-book copies of George Orwell’s “1984” and “Animal Farm” from customers’ Kindle devices after the company determined the editions were unauthorized.
snippet: Amazon.com deleted purchased e-book copies of George Orwell’s “1984” and “Animal Farm” from customers’ Kindle devices after the company determined the editions were unauthorized.
lead_paragraph: EDITOR’S NOTE | 8:41 p.m.  The Times published an article explaining that the Orwell books were unauthorized editions that Amazon removed from its Kindle store. However, Amazon said it would not automatically remove purchased copies of Kindle books if a similar situation arose in the future.

headline.main: Amazon.com Plays Big Brother With Famous E-Books
